question.question-text: It is mentioned in paragraph 1 that Will Rogers was known for all of the following EXCEPT for his work

answer-list.answer-text: as a rancher

question.explain-text: The passage states that he reached a wide following with his stage act, lectures, newspaper and magazine articles, films, radio broadcasts, and books. This means that paragraph 1 mentions his work as a speaker giving lectures, his work as a writer of newspaper and magazine articles and books, and his work as an actor in films. The first answer is the one that is not mentioned and is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: According to paragraph 2, when Will Rogers was born, his family was

answer-list.answer-text: friendly
urban
casual

question.explain-text: The passage states that Will Rogers was the youngest of eight children of a comfortable Oklahoma family. This means that, when he was born, his family was well-off. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: According to paragraph 2, it is NOT true that Will Rogers

answer-list.answer-text: failed to graduate from high school
attended a military school
left a military school without explanation

question.explain-text: The passage states that he was not a very dedicated student. This means that it is NOT true that Will Rogers was a good student. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It is NOT mentioned in paragraph 2 that Will Rogers

answer-text.exp: took part in a Western show in South Africa
traveled with a circus in Australia

answer-list.answer-text: was a circus performer in the United States

answer-text.exp: worked as a trick roper in New York

question.explain-text: The passage states that he worked as a trick rider in Texas Jack's Wild West Show in South Africa and later toured around Australia and New Zealand with a circus and that he began working in vaudeville shows in New York City as a trick roper. This means that it is mentioned that Will Rogers took part in a Western show in South Africa in the first answer, that he traveled with a circus in Australia in the second answer, and that he worked as a trick roper in New York in the last answer. The third answer is the one that is NOT mentioned and is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It is indicated in paragraph 2 that Will Rogers first became successful when he

answer-list.answer-text: began telling jokes during his nightclub act

answer-text.exp: introduced humor into his vaudeville act

answer-list.answer-text: incorporated new and exciting tricks into his rope act
introduced a Wild West act into the circus

question.explain-text: The passage mentions vaudeville shows in New York City as a trick roper and then states that he experienced his first success as a performer when he began telling jokes during his act. This means that Will Rogers first became successful when he introduced humor into his vaudeville act. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It is stated in paragraph 3 that Will Rogers' act with the Ziegfeld Follies was

answer-list.answer-text: on stage for only a year
described in newspapers
performed three times per week

question.explain-text: The passage states that Rogers was hired by the Ziegfeld Follies and quickly became a star of the show. This means that his act with the Ziegfeld Follies was well-received. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: According to paragraph 3, Will Rogers' 1919 publications were based upon

answer-list.answer-text: newspaper stories that he wrote
the performers in the Ziegfeld Follies

answer-text.exp:
humor from his act about current
events

answer-list.answer-text: the life of cowboys

question.explain-text: The passage states that using newspaper stories as his source material, he was able to come up with comic material for three shows daily with the Follies and that by 1919, he had gathered enough successful jokes to create two collections of his humor. This means that Will Rogers' 1919 publications were based on humor from his act about current events. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It is stated in paragraph 4 that in 1918 Will Rogers

answer-list.answer-text: settled permanently in California
achieved success as a movie actor

answer-text.exp: found work as a public speaker

answer-list.answer-text: began writing a weekly column

question.explain-text: The passage states that in 1918, he returned to New York, where he immediately found a different forum for his humorous commentary as an after-dinner speaker. This means that in 1918 Will Rogers found work as a public speaker. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: According to paragraph 4, it is NOT true that Will Rogers' newspaper columns

answer-list.answer-text: first appeared in 1922
were published once a week
were carried in McNaught Syndicate papers

question.explain-text: The passage states that he was asked to write a weekly column for the syndicate, a position he maintained for the rest of his life. This means that it is NOT true that Will Rogers' newspaper columns ended in 1924. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It is NOT stated in paragraph 5 that in 1926 Will Rogers

answer-list.answer-text: wrote a series of articles for the Saturday Evening Post
published a volume of articles
sent a daily message to the New York Times

question.explain-text: The passage states that in 1926 he made his first radio broadcast, which eventually became a popular series of weekly broadcasts. This means that it is stated that he made his first radio broadcast in 1926, but it is NOT stated that he made twice-weekly radio broadcasts in 1926. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It is stated in paragraph 6 that

answer-list.answer-text: Rogers' first attempt at a film career was quite unsuccessful
the film industry was not very interested in making films starring Rogers
Rogers' second attempt at a film career was not as successful as his first

answer-text.exp: the film industry made a strong attempt to convince him to try making movies one more time

question.explain-text: The passage states that he was soon sought after by the film industry for a second attempt at moviemaking. This means that the film industry made a strong attempt to convince him to try making movies one more time. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: According to paragraph 7, Will Rogers sometimes

answer-text.exp: made sharp criticisms of the country

answer-list.answer-text: pointed out his immense popularity
refused to reflect on the essence of life in America
felt that criticism was unnecessary

question.explain-text: The passage states that though his criticisms of the country's current foibles could be pointed. This means that Will Rogers sometimes made sharp criticisms of the country. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It is stated in paragraph 7 that, in the long term, Will Rogers was

answer-list.answer-text: unsure whether or not his popularity would continue

answer-text.exp: quite positive about the potential of the country

answer-list.answer-text: highly critical of where the country was heading
certain that the current problems of the country would continue

question.explain-text: The passage states that overall Rogers reflected a genuine optimism about the future of the country and its citizens. This means that Will Rogers was quite positive about the potential of the country. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.
